Node.definition: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= man; ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= to perform an event that one has already performed before

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which deities are extremely angry with someone else ► which is likely to result in punishment

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= area; ◄ territory of the most prominent tribe of Edom (אֱדֹום) ; ≈ sometimes used to refer to the entire territory of Edom

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= desert; ◄ located south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) west of Edom (אֱדֹום) and north of Sinai (סִינַי) desert
literally: to cover; hence: = state in which a certain condition is visible over a very large area
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= beam of light
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= process by which an event takes place without being visible
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= a destructive and deadly condition which affects nature
literally: at the feet; hence: = a reference to the location behind a moving party

= action by which humans or deities ascertain the size or quantity of something by comparing it with a standard unit or with an object of known size|= process by which deites cause objects to move up and down or to and fro

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: going; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= land or ethnic group, possibly related to Midian (מִדְיָן)

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions
= construction ◄ made up of tent curtains

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a flowing body of water, but here referring to a specific river or rivers
= process by which humans or deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= a flowing body of water, but here referring to a specific river or rivers
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
literally: to uncover bare; hence: = causative action by which someone removes the covering from an object
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting and in warfare
= words spoken by humans and deities
= a flowing body of water, but here referring to a specific river or rivers

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to tremble|to be distressed|to be in anguish
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

= great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
literally: to lift up (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans raise their arms to receive out, beckon, bless, or pray
= one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside; ≈ associated with high status

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
literally: arrow; hence: = visible electric discharge between cloud and ground, shaped and moving like an arrow and considered to consist of fire
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light
= process by which an object reflects light, often because it has been polished
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= action by which humans or deities move purposefully in a certain direction

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a (non eschatological) ruler appointed by God and anointed with oil by a prophet or priest
= action by which humans strike other humans or animals with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities|literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

Node.gloss: to uncover|to make bare|to strip|to lay bare
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed|literally: to uncover; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to take off their clothes and become (fully or partially) naked, ≈ which is regarded as shameful
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride
= causative action by which humans use a sharp object to make a hole through an object
= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting and in warfare

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
meaning unsure; possibly related to פְּרָזִי : = person living in the open country and therefore required to fight for their king in times of war|meaning unsure: = person in a position of leadership
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= a place where humans or animals go in order to not be readily seen by others, ► either to keep safe from danger or to attack others

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= process by which liquids form small bubbles, ◄ due to fermentation
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions
= entire human body ◄ as a metonymic extension of the belly
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= process by which a certain moment in time arrives
= to set upon forcibly with force and weapons

= a tree that reaches a height of 5 8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= general term for plants that are sources of food; ≈ a sign of God's blessing

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= state of not being available, ◄ described as not having been true

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, ► sometimes used for farming or pasturing animals

Node.gloss: to bear|to yield|to produce|to bring forth
Node.definition: literally: to make; hence: = natural process by which land, plants, or animals develop vegetation, branches, fruits, produce milk, etc.
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= process by which objects are forcefully removed from a location

= area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth
= construction, probably in the shape of a semi circular enclosure ► where domestic animals are fed
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

= state in which a human being, animal, or deity is deemed worthy of respect because of characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= female of אַיָּל (אַיָּל)
literally: the back (of an area); hence: = the highest situated parts of a certain location, often representing the entire location
= action by which deities cause humans or animals to move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn
= action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= action by which humans play an instrument with strings, such as a lute (כִּנֹּור) or lyre (נֵבֶל) which can be for silent meditation or to accompany singing and dancing
